title: Book Talk with Iris Bohnet
dateTime: Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 12:00 PM EDT to Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 1:00 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Online Online Location Online Location Instructions Please register for Zoom information.
description:
Book Talk with Iris Bohnet
 
Lectures • Virtual Radcliffe Book Talks
Tuesday, July 22, 2025
12 PM ET
Online on Zoom
 
The second installment in our series features Iris Bohnet, coauthor of Make Work Fair: Data-Driven Design for Real Results (Harper Business Press, 2025) with Siri Chilazi. A behavioral economist and leading voice on equity in the workplace, Bohnet advises governments and companies around the world.
 
For more information and to register, please visit:

title: Farmers' Market at Harvard
dateTime: Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 11:30 AM EDT to Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 5:30 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Science Center Plaza 1 Oxford St., Cambridge, MA View Map
description:
Grab your shopping bag and join us at the farmers' market every Tuesday through October 28th, 11:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Help support the vital local farmers and food artisans who ensure we have fresh, healthy food!
Stop by for lemonade, local mushrooms, early summer produce, eggs, microgreens, freshly baked bread, cookies, iced coffee, and more!
The market accepts SNAP with a weekly maximum SNAP Match of $15.
Participating vendors also accept HIP, WIC and Senior FMNP Coupons.

title: Trans+ Space
dateTime: Wednesday, July 23 2025 at 5:00 PM EDT to Wednesday, July 23 2025 at 7:00 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Project Room (3rd floor), Smith Campus Center 1350 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge , MA View Map
description:
About the Event:
This is an affinity space for individuals who are trans+ (binary or non-binary) and/or gender diverse. All Harvard affiliates and their guests are warmly welcomed, including undergraduates, graduate students, post-bacs, staff, residents, fellows, postdocs, and faculty. We will have games and art supplies for crafting available in the space.
 
Food & Drinks:
Enjoy a casual dinner and drinks, provided free of charge!
host: s Office of Culture, Community, and Engagement LGBTQ@GSAS, a Harvard Griffin GSAS Student Group

title: Productivity to PhD (Additional Session Added!!)
dateTime: Monday, July 14 2025 at 1:00 PM EDT to Friday, July 25 2025 at 2:30 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Online Online Location Join Event Online Online Location Instructions To join the group and receive the Zoom links for each session, please register through the ARC Scheduler.
description:
Additional Session Added!!  
 
Do you want to make significant progress to your prospectus, dissertation, or other research or writing project this summer? With a wide-open schedule and reduced social support, how can you be sure you will get down to work each day? Easy! Register for Productivity to PhD, set a goal, and join us for two weeks of daily jump starts!
An academic coach and a small group of doctoral students will meet every weekday morning for shared structure, accountability, and encouragement. At each session, after a brief check-in to review the prior day’s progress and set goals for the work hour, each student will work independently on- or off-line for 60 minutes. The group will then reconvene at 2:15 p.m. to share progress, troubleshoot as needed, and set goals for the rest of the day. Participants are also encouraged to share wins, challenges, and strategies for success.
 
Meets from 1:00 p.m. to 2:30 p.m. every weekday from July 14 through July 25.  Register in advance through the Academic Resource Center Scheduler.
Upon registration, you will receive an email with Zoom links for each day.
 
Daily attendance is suggested for group accountability. Open to all Harvard Griffin GSAS students.

title: Game Guild - Heavy Game Night
dateTime: Friday, July 25 2025 at 6:00 PM EDT to Friday, July 25 2025 at 9:30 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Lehman Hall - Room 204 (Grad Student Lounge) 8 Harvard Yard View Map
description:
Greetings fellow adventurers! Game Guild returns with our heavy game night, featuring deeper games of strategy and adventure! Heavy games often require greater investment to learn and play. All our welcome to enjoy these more involved offerings beyond our general open boardgame night!
WHEN 6pm - 9:30pm on Fridays. Please see the event for the specific date.
WHERE Lehman Room 204 (Graduate Student Lounge).
 
All are welcome! Please sign up beforehand to help coordinate games. Feel free to join our Discord for game night discussions.
 
More upcoming events are posted on our calendar!
 
Join our Engage group for up-to-date communication on Guild news, leadership opportunities, pilot programs, and other exciting adventures! To join, ensure you're signed in to Engage, then press the "Join" button on the upper right.
host: Game Guild, a Harvard Griffin GSAS Student Group

title: Book Talk with Geraldine Brooks
dateTime: Tuesday, August 5 2025 at 12:00 PM EDT to Tuesday, August 5 2025 at 1:00 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Online Online Location Online Location Instructions Please register for Zoom information.
description:
Book Talk with Geraldine Brooks
Lectures • Virtual Radcliffe Book Talks
Tuesday, August 5, 2025
12 PM ET
Online on Zoom
 
 
The fourth and final installment in our series features Geraldine Brooks RI ’06, author of Memorial Days: A Memoir (Viking, 2025). A Pulitzer Prize–winning novelist, nonfiction writer, and former foreign correspondent, Brooks blends personal narrative and historical reflection in this meditation on grief, war, and memory, written in the wake of the death of her husband, the writer Tony Horwitz RI ’06, also a Pulitzer-prize winner.
 
 
 
For more information and to register, please visit:

title: Youth in Public Health Symposium, Dongguan 2025
dateTime: Monday, August 4 2025 at 9:00 AM EDT to Friday, August 8 2025 at 5:00 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
description:
ABOUT YPHS
The Youth in Public Health Symposium (YPHS) was established in 2016 by Dr. Liming Liang, a Professor of Statistical Genetics in the Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics. The symposium aims to expose high school students to different fields of public health and provide practical examples of the knowledge they learn in science classes. This helps students learn how rigorous research is done in public health and make informed decisions about their future college majors. YPHS incorporates nano-courses that allow students to connect with leading researchers, acquire fundamental knowledge, and develop community projects in public health areas. For the symposiums from previous years, please click on the links (2024 Dongguan Camp, 2024 Boston Camp, 2023 Shanghai Camp, 2023 Boston Camp, 2020 Online Forum, 2019 Boston Camp, 2018 Boston Camp).
 
ABOUT THE DONGGUAN 2025 PROGRAM
This summer school in Dongguan, Guangdong Province, China, is part of the YPHS programs designed specifically for high school students. The event will be held from August 4th to 8th, 2025, at Tsinglan School.
As a non-profit initiative, this program offers participants the opportunity to:
- Engage with world-class scholars: Work closely with Harvard University professors and current doctoral students to explore cutting-edge topics in public health and learn about academic and career pathways in the field.
- Collaborate with talented peers: Join a community of outstanding high school students to conduct group-based, project-style research, delve into public health knowledge, and enjoy the excitement of scientific inquiry.
- Apply knowledge to real-world challenges: Investigate public health issues, and use scientific knowledge to create meaningful solutions, shaping yourself into a future leader in public health.
- Receive formal recognition: Earn a certificate of completion issued by a Harvard University professor.
- Expand your global experience: Outstanding participants may be invited to the Youth in Public Health Symposium in Boston in Spring 2026.
 
Program Highlights
- Pre-program preparation: Students will receive curated reading and preparatory materials in June 2025, designed by the Harvard team.
- Core and elective courses: A flexible course system combining essential public health topics and personalized electives, allowing students to tailor their learning experience.
- Research and presentations: Under the guidance of Harvard doctoral students, participants will apply their knowledge to address pressing public health challenges, culminating in research proposals, oral presentations, and academic poster displays.
 
Recruitment Details
- Enrollment: 100 students
- Eligibility: Students entering grades 9–12 in the 2025–2026 academic year with a strong academic foundation, a keen interest in public health, and proficiency in English.
- Application: Students are required to submit an application form. More details and specific requirements can be found at here.
host: Interdisciplinary Discussion on Disease and Health, a Harvard Griffin GSAS Student Group

title: GSAS Peer Mentor Training
dateTime: Friday, September 12 2025 at 9:00 AM EDT to Friday, September 12 2025 at 1:00 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
description:
The Office of Student Services is hosting the GSAS Peer Mentoring Training for current and prospective peer mentors within Harvard Griffin GSAS. In this training, participants will have the opportunity to engage in listening skills and coaching strategies while learning about vital university resources that support the graduate student journey.
The peer mentor training will take place at the GSAS Student Center at Lehman Hall on Friday, September 12 from 9:00 am-1:00 p.m.
The Student Center welcomes individuals with disabilities to participate in its programs and activities. If you would like to request accommodations for events or have questions, please contact  stucenter@fas.harvard.edu or 614-495-2255 in advance of the event.
Questions about the event? Email stuserv@fas.harvard.edu 
Perks
 Free Food
